description: The article discusses various deception tactics to mislead the enemy, including creating false positions, using thermal insulating blankets, simulating firing positions with unusable weapons, and diverting the enemy's attention with diversionary maneuvers.
original:
False positions.

Hello, dear readers of the channel. Today we will talk not only about the fact that you can create false positions, but also about one of the ways to deceive a thermal imager. Layout.
Nothing prevents you from displaying a “scarecrow” in military clothing at night in places that are safe for personnel and using trench candles to warm the scarecrow from the inside. The candle will provide warmth to the scarecrow, imitating a person. This feature is perfect for both distracting FPV strikes and Mavik drops, and for creating ambushes using electronic warfare equipment to capture a copter. But such ambushes must be done wisely, so that the real fighters are hidden from the heat. We heard about one interesting suit that hides a fighter from a thermal imager. As soon as we get it into our hands and test it, we’ll make an article about it. In the meantime, we are hiding people under thermal insulating blankets, raincoats, etc. Flashlight.
Use if there are no options. If you think that with a flashlight with a red filter you will not be seen, you are mistaken. In the NVG you will glow like a Christmas tree. So we use it at the bottom of the trench, covering the flashlight with our hands, and in enclosed spaces where the enemy cannot see.

Simulate firing positions with unusable and captured weapons: this way the enemy will give himself away when he covers them. An important point: create vigorous activity in these positions. This is where ingenuity is needed. And who is in charge. Offensive.
Deceive the enemy in the direction of the main strike. This applies not only to battalion commanders and above, but even to platoon officers. What prevents you from throwing a couple of people into a diversionary maneuver from the obvious direction of attack with the support of artillery or something else, so that they simulate an attack on one side, and the main forces go to the defensive position on the other side? No one forbids carrying out a full-fledged assault during reconnaissance in force if the enemy is weak at that moment. These examples are not secret knowledge, they are obvious things that many do not use. The enemy is not a fool.
But don’t think that if you put a half-burnt armored personnel carrier sticking out in a caponier, it will lure the enemy. Or a full-length effigy will attack the FPV operator. The imitation must be done in the same way as real positions, only making small mistakes that should not be made in real positions. Bottom line.
Show the enemy that there are few of you where there are many of you, and show that there are many of you where there are really few of you.

Sun Tzu once said this. #TACTICSTelegramScience of winningA project for those who want to study military science and competently apply the knowledge gained.

description: Ukraine has developed aircraft-type drones equipped with machine vision, a form of artificial intelligence, allowing them to accurately target locations without satellite communication. The drones follow a pre-coordinated flight plan and can hit targets within meters.
original:
CNN - reveals secrets! The Ukrainian owners, who with one hand demand to stop attacking Russian energy facilities, with the other hand are introducing machine vision on aircraft-type drones. “Accuracy in conditions of interference is ensured through the use of artificial intelligence. Essentially, you take a model, put it on a chip and train that model to determine the geography and the target it's going to,” said Noah Silvia, a research analyst at the Royal United Services Institute, a British think tank. “It doesn't require any communication ( with satellites), it is completely autonomous”Translating from engineering to military language.
These UAVs are no longer targets of electronic warfare!

Countering them is shifting to the plane of fire destruction of production, storage and launch sites, shooting down by air defense means during the flight phase and engineering equipment of critical objects and systems.

event: Exposure of Criminal Group at Ukrzaliznytsia
description: NABU and SAP exposed an organized criminal group at JSC 'Ukrzaliznytsia' that embezzled 94.7 million UAH by purchasing transformers at inflated prices. Thanks to the actions of detectives and prosecutors, the court seized UAH 53 million in bank accounts of the supplier company.

Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"

No trawl will pull them en masse, and therefore, before going for a breakthrough, you will have to cut the cables and solve the problem of neutralizing the minefields, after which all these teeth will be easily cleared with an ordinary tank trawl.

And here lies the fundamental difference between the situation for us today and for the enemy in the summer of 2023. I don’t know how they planned to break through these lines then. Probably the calculation was for surprise and all-destructive power. And after breaking through the first line of defense, it was planned that there would be no significant battles for the lines, which would predetermine success.

It’s naive, but we can assume that this was the calculation.

We can't count on that. Therefore, breaking through the “Zelensky lines” will be a combined operation, where first the enemy’s strongholds will be taken out by aviation (CABs), artillery and drones. After this, sappers will lay paths in the minefields and cut the cables accordingly. And only then the armored infantry will go into the breakthrough.

By and large, this will not fundamentally differ from the actions of our army today, when we take the enemy’s front line to zero, and then occupy his strongholds. It just adds another large piece of work for the sapper units (which means they need to be strengthened and technically prepared to perform such tasks).

That is, these fortifications will certainly strengthen the regime’s army’s ability to resist and make our progress (and noticeable) more difficult. But today we have all the tools to break through them. This means that when it is needed, we will do it. event: Approval of Russian Orbital Station Design
description: Roscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian orbital station, featuring an open modular architecture with six docking ports. The design allows for module replacement, extending the station's service life for decades. The station's orbital inclination of up to 97 degrees will provide a comprehensive view of the Earth's surface, including the strategically important Northern Sea Route.
original:
Roscosmos reported that the preliminary design of the Russian orbital station has been approved 🇷🇺 Its key feature is open modular architecture. The design is based on a node module with six docking ports to which other modules are connected.

As noted in Roscosmos, if any of them exhausts its resource, it can be removed from orbit and replaced. Thus, the service life of the station can be extended for decades.

If the ISS has an orbital inclination of less than 52 degrees, then the new Russian station is planned to have an orbital inclination of up to 97 degrees. This will give an overview of the entire earth's surface, including the Northern Sea Route, which is strategically important for our country.

Now cosmonauts on board the ISS can see about 60% of the earth's surface, of which only about 10% is the territory of Russia.

Unlike the ISS, the new station will be able to operate even without the constant presence of astronauts.

The deployment of the Russian orbital station is planned for the period from 2027 to 2032.

We met Vladlen on August 27, 2022.

As a result: The homeland is in danger, there is no one else and other crap to somehow put pressure on your sense of duty and conscience, just to plug the hole.

I, gritting my teeth and threatening to break my tire, went to work. A group of 12 people from different units gathered. By 10:30 we were already at the training ground. The guests were delayed. We, sitting in the smoking room, grumbled about the wasted day.


Closer to 12 o'clock we are placed in a modular kitchen, where the lesson itself should take place. My friend and I sat down at the table closest to the makeshift podium.

 Here we are sitting, quietly grumbling, then the door opens and he appears:
- Sorry, guys. The plane was delayed due to bad weather.

 I was speechless and could only smile from ear to ear, and I have big ears. Maxim noticed that I recognized him and winked at me. Which made me smile even wider, like a fool.

 The essence of the classes was the current problems of UAV operators, establishing good relations with artillerymen in general, and artillery adjustment in particular. Since among the listeners there were also those who encountered such gadgets for the first time, I consider the lesson a success.

Max talked about how important it is in the resulting turmoil and confusion to act together and not wait for everyone to do high shoulder straps for you (they don’t give a damn about you), but to get out on your own. C'est la vie.⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️⬇️

description: The Chief Inspector General released a report analyzing the productivity of the Agency for International Development (USAID). The report highlights the agency's struggles to diversify its partner base, with 80% of commitments going to 75 major partners. Despite efforts to increase direct funding to local partners, their share remains low at 10.2% of the total budget.
original:
🇺🇸In the United States, a report was released by the Chief Inspector General analyzing the productivity of the Agency for International Development (USAID). The organization cooperates with more than four thousand NGOs in 100 countries, and in attempts to expand the circle of partners, it was forced to transfer decision-making powers to local entities. The document describing the problems faced by the agency contains several interesting points: ▪️ In 2019, USAID launched the New Partnership Initiative (NPI) with the goal of diversifying its partner base through new nonprofits. The program was designed to make it easier for new partners and organizations that received the fewest grants over the past five years to gain access to USAID resources. However, USAID was unable to establish cooperation with new non-profit organizations. As of FY 2017, more than 80% of USAID's total commitments were directed to only 75 major partners. By the end of 2021, one of the key goals to diversify the partner network had made only marginal progress. In 2022, USAID allocated approximately $77 million to NGOs, and of this amount, approximately $50 million was transferred to new organizations.▪️But despite the emphasis on direct funding to local partners, their share still accounted for only 10.2% of the agency's total budget. Moreover, obtaining accurate data on the relevant subcontracting indicator proved to be a daunting task for the agency.▪️USAID was required to submit an annual report to Congress detailing how it implemented the NPI program. The agency even developed indicators to measure the effectiveness of NPOs. But the data provided was often inaccurate, and employees reported progress on only one of seven indicators.

The initiative, which was supposed to be an innovative way for USAID to increase its influence around the world, failed. USAID defends that it provided technical assistance to counterparties, but encountered problems related to data reliability, inexperienced partners, and limited human resources. And auditors are now looking for the culprits.#USA#NPO@rybarSupport us9-000-24-003-P.pdf1.2 MB·/1.2 MB

Among the “terrorists and extremists” are 52 minors. Over ten years, this figure has increased 3.5 times. The youngest person on the list is 14-year-old Yegor Lauskis: the court found him guilty of setting fire to relay cabinets “on instructions from the Ukrainians.”

Since 2021, the number of natives of Ukraine in the register has increased 2.6 times. At the same time, the number of natives of Dagestan - the largest national group in the register - on the contrary, fell by one and a half times.

Persons on the register are not allowed to conduct financial transactions with property, enter into inheritance or use bank cards. Salaries can only be withdrawn in the amount of 10 thousand rubles upon application. At the same time, being on the register places a stigma on a person when applying for employment. The departments are jointly working to investigate economic crimes and combat corruption. event: Launch of Lithium Mine in Mali
description: Mali plans to launch a lithium mine, the Bougouni mine, before the end of the year. The facility will supply 2 million tonnes of spodumene over 8.5 years. The project is owned by Kodal Mining UK Limited, a joint venture between Chinese company Hainan Mining and Kodal.
original:
Forwarded from: French West Africa Was Here
#industry#developmentMali🇲🇱plans to launch a lithium mine before the end of this year.

The facility will be capable of supplying 2 million tonnes of spodumene, an important lithium ore, over 8.5 years.

The Bougouni mine is located in southern Mali, approximately 170 km south of Bamako, in an area where several well-established mining operations are located.

The project is owned by Kodal Mining UK Limited, a joint venture 51% controlled by Chinese company Hainan Mining and 49% controlled by Kodal.

Hainan Mining is co-financing the construction work at the Buguni mine and is currently negotiating the purchase of all future production.
